channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Rangers sack Martin after 17 games
item.description: Russell Martin is sacked as Rangers head coach after 17 games in charge in the wake of Sunday's 1-1 draw with Falkirk.

item.title: Postecoglou 'expects' talks with Forest owner and vows to 'fight'
item.description: Ange Postecoglou "expects" talks to be held with owner Evangelos Marinakis about his start as Nottingham Forest manager - but says he "loves a fight".

item.title: 'I'll take Ferguson & Wenger to dinner' - Guardiola on 250 wins record
item.description: Pep Guardiola says he will celebrate landmark of 250 Premier League wins in record time by inviting Sir Alex Ferguson and Arsene Wenger to dinner.

item.title: 'Grealish for England'? Everton loanee giving Tuchel a 'headache'
item.description: Two days after being left out of the England squad, has Jack Grealish given manager Thomas Tuchel "a headache"?

item.title: How Martin's Rangers reign fell apart in 123 days
item.description: Russell Martin started his Rangers reign by telling doubters in the support he could prove them wrong. Just 123 days later, it is all over.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Nowhere near our level' but Celtic show 'heart' in landmark win
item.description: Celtic were "nowhere near our level" but showed "grit" to fight back and secure the 200th win of Brendan Rodgers' two spells in charge.

item.title: This is why we tried to be gentle - Guardiola on Rodri injury
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola hopes Rodri will not be sidelined for longer than “two or three weeks” after the midfielder was forced off in the first half of Sunday’s victory over Brentford.

item.title: Monday's gossip: Reguilon holds Inter Miami talks
item.description: Sergio Reguilon is in talks with Inter Miami, Chelsea want Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo, Arsenal send scouts to watch Kenan Yildiz, plus more.

item.title: Haaland goal gives Guardiola 250th Premier League victory
item.description: Watch highlights as Erling Haaland's early goal gives manager Pep Guardiola his 250th Premier League victory, with Manchester City scraping a win at Brentford.

item.title: Grealish's 93rd-minute winner ends Palace unbeaten run
item.description: Watch highlights as Jack Grealish scores a dramatic 93rd-minute winner to end Crystal Palace's club-record 19-match unbeaten run.

item.title: Newcastle beat Forest to keep pressure on Postegoclou
item.description: Ange Postecoglou's winless start at Nottingham Forest continues, as Nick Woltemade and Bruno Guimaraes fire Newcastle United to victory at St James' Park.

item.title: Malen double sees Villa beat struggling Burnley
item.description: Donyell Malen scores twice to help Aston Villa beat struggling Burnley at Villa Park to get their fourth-consecutive win in all competitions.

item.title: Late Van Hecke goal denies Wolves first win
item.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers boss Vitor Pereira is sent off, as Jan Paul van Hecke's late header denies Wolves their first Premier League win of the season.

item.title: Watch Martin's final Rangers interview
item.description: Russell Martin gives his final interview to BBC Scotland as Rangers head coach before being sacked hours after the 1-1 draw at Falkirk.

item.title: Two stunning strikes help Villa extend West Ham's losing start
item.description: Aston Villa claim their first WSL win of the season with two impressive goals and inflict a seventh successive league loss on West Ham.

item.title: 'I could be at home watching TV' - Postecoglou welcomes pressure
item.description: Nottingham Forest head coach Ange Postecoglou says he "loves a challenge" and that the results will come following his side's 2-0 defeat by Newcastle United.

item.title: Tottenham beat Brighton to move third in WSL
item.description: Watch highlights as Cathinka Tandberg scores her third Women's Super League goal of the season as Tottenham beat Brighton 1-0 to move third in the table.

item.title: One of Man City's best first halves in months - Guardiola
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says it was one of his side's best first halves in months, after the Blues ran out 1-0 winners away at Brentford in the Premier League.

item.title: Nine games, nine losses for troubled West Ham & Liverpool
item.description: Nine games, nine defeats. Three goals scored, 24 conceded. The combined records of Liverpool and West Ham United in the Women's Super League make very bleak reading.

item.title: 'We have to keep this energy' - can Aberdeen build on first win?
item.description: Can Aberdeen's first Scottish Premiership win at the seventh attempt spark their season into life?

item.title: What's changed since Newcastle takeover?
item.description: Tuesday marks the four-year anniversary of Newcastle United's takeover, so what has changed?

item.title: From last-gasp winners to woes - Liverpool's late goal problem
item.description: Liverpool's remarkable run of either scoring or conceding late goals continues - and their fortune has run out, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Odegaard out of Norway squad with knee injury
item.description: Arsenal captain Martin Odegaard withdraws from Norway's squad for their upcoming international matches after injuring his left knee against West Ham.

item.title: 'Are you Schmeichel in disguise?' Lammens serenaded on Man Utd debut
item.description: Senne Lammens was compared to Peter Schmeichel in fan chants on his Manchester United debut - but how did he really get on?

item.title: 'He's going to be special' - the moment Estevao arrived
item.description: Estevao Willian announces his arrival in English football with his first Chelsea goal - a late winner against champions Liverpool.

item.title: 'Good on them for being excited' - should Hearts fans dare to dream of title?
item.description: Derek McInnes says Hearts fans are right to be excited after a late derby winner sends his side five points clear in the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: Dribble king Kudus impresses again amid 'big expectations'
item.description: Mohammed Kudus scored and assisted in Tottenham's win over Leeds as he shows again why he is becoming Tottenham's most influential player.

item.title: Blackpool sack veteran boss Bruce after poor start
item.description: Blackpool sack veteran boss Steve Bruce after one year in charge after a poor start to the League One season.

item.title: Wales proving there is life after Bale - Bellamy
item.description: Wales boss Craig Bellamy aims to give a glimpse of the team's future when they face England at Wembley next week.

item.title: Man City believe but will they win WSL this season?
item.description: Manchester City's belief has grown but are they capable of winning the Women's Super League this season?

item.title: Wafcon expands to 16 teams for 2026 finals
item.description: The Women's Africa Cup of Nations will expand from 12 to 16 teams beginning with the 2026 finals in Morocco.

item.title: Ex-Portsmouth, Leicester and Sheffield Wednesday owner Mandaric dies
item.description: Former Portsmouth, Leicester City and Sheffield Wednesday owner Milan Mandaric dies at the age of 87.

item.title: 'Maybe we needed it' - Glasner on losing unbeaten record
item.description: Crystal Palace manager head coach Oliver Glasner admits it "hurts" to see his side lose their club-record 19-match unbeaten run after conceding a 93rd-minute goal in a 2-1 loss to Everton, but believes it could be beneficial to Palace in the long run.

item.title: Grealish has helped Everton an awful lot - Moyes
item.description: Everton head coach David Moyes reflects on Jack Grealish's performance after he scored an extra time goal to claim the three points against Crystal Palace.

item.title: Leicester hold Everton at home to end losing run
item.description: Leicester's Noemie Mouchon comes off the bench to score an 81st minute equaliser in their 1-1 draw against Everton.

item.title: Liverpool remain pointless after late penalty gives London City win
item.description: Liverpool remain pointless in the Women's Super League after London City Lionesses' 89th-minute penalty gives them three points at Hayes Lane.

item.title: Confidence important for 'protaganist' Malen - Emery
item.description: Aston Villa head coach Unai Emery says he will continue to work with Donyell Malen to find out his best position, and that confidence is most important for the Dutchman after he scored twice to beat Burnley at Villa Park.

item.title: Burnley have a theme of switching off - Parker
item.description: Burnley head coach Scott Parker admits his side have a theme of "switching off" that is costing them games, after they lost 2-1 to Aston Villa at Villa Park.

item.title: Watch as Martin leaves Falkirk separately before being sacked
item.description: Watch Russell Martin leave Falkirk separately as Rangers fans hold up the team bus.

item.title: Schmeichel in disguise? - Lammens impresses Rooney in 'solid' debut
item.description: Former Manchester United and Everton striker Wayne Rooney says Senne Lammens had a solid debut for Man Utd after his deadline-day move from Royal Antwerp- keeping a clean sheet in his new side's 2-0 win over Sunderland in the Premier League.

item.title: Vinicius scores twice as Real Madrid move top
item.description: Watch highlights as Vinicius Jr scores twice for Real Madrid as they beat Villarreal 3-1 to go top of La Liga.

item.title: How Chelsea exploited Liverpool's full-backs
item.description: Former Manchester United and Everton striker Wayne Rooney explains how Chelsea exploited Liverpool down the flanks in their 2-1 win in the Premier League at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: How Arsenal's squad upgrade is paying off
item.description: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer examines how Arsenal have improved their squad depth since last season, and how the Gunners reaped the rewards in their win over West Ham.

item.title: The younger Mbappe emerging from his brother's shadow
item.description: Being the brother of a football superstar is not easy. But Ethan Mbappe is aiming to emerge from the shadows and make a name for himself.

item.title: Why Liverpool aren't getting the best from Wirtz yet
item.description: A deep dive into Florian Wirtz's performances for Liverpool so far and why he isn't yet at his best.

item.title: Tickets, bots & touts - is Chelsea relationship with fans turning sour?
item.description: Chelsea are back in the Champions League, but relations between parts of the fanbase and the club hierarchy have turned sour.

item.title: Arsenal lead set-piece trend as NFL tactics spread
item.description: Umir Irfan looks at how football teams are using blocking moves at set-pieces in a similar way to how NFL players block their opponents.

item.title: Is Nuno the right man for West Ham?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how Nuno Espirito Santo might fit in as West Ham manager, based on his recent experience with Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are Kazakhstan part of Uefa?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Kazakhstan are part of Uefa.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: Why was Calafiori banned from using a towel for throw-ins?
item.description: Arsenal's Riccardo Calafiori was stopped from drying the ball with a towel against Newcastle - but why did that happen?

item.title: What is meldonium and can it enhance a footballer's performance?
item.description: Meldonium use has led to significant bans for several prominent athletes.

item.title: What is the Champions League anthem?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at how the Champions League anthem was created and what the lyrics are.

item.title: Is the Premier League getting younger?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks into why increasing number of teenagers and young players are playing in the Premier League this season.

item.title: Martin given police escort after last game as boss
item.description: Angry Rangers fans try to prevent the team bus leaving the Falkirk Stadium following the 1-1 draw on Sunday, with a large police presence required to allow players and staff to exit.

item.title: San Siro could be demolished as sale approved
item.description: AC Milan and Inter Milan say they are "pleased" with the approval of a sale of the iconic San Siro to the clubs - which could lead to its demolition.

item.title: Simeone given one-match ban for Liverpool fans clash
item.description: Atletico Madrid manager Diego Simeone is banned for one match for clashing with Liverpool fans.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
